meanings.sent1: The inexactitude of the map led us to the wrong location.
meanings.sent2: The scientist admitted the inexactitude of his measurements.
meanings.sent3: The inexactitude of the weather forecast made us bring both an umbrella and sunglasses.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was like an inexactitude, always slightly off.
meanings.sent5: The inexactitude of his aim caused him to miss the target by inches.

meanings.definition: The quality of being imprecise or inaccurate.
meanings.sent1: We couldn't rely on the inexactitude of the old scale.
meanings.sent2: The inexactitude of the painting gave it a unique charm.
meanings.sent3: The inexactitude of the clock made us late for the meeting.
meanings.sent4: The inexactitude of her directions led us in circles.
meanings.sent5: The inexactitude of his memory made it hard to trust his stories.
